item.title: 挪威2.2万亿美元主权财富基金就撤回报告发表看法
item.description: 去年12月，一份关键气候报告的撤回曾被视为全球变暖经济成本被夸大的证据。如今，挪威主权财富基金表示，其自身分析表明这种结论是错误的。【原文：Back in December, the retraction of a key climate report was seen as proof that the economic cost of global warming had been overstated. Now, Norway’s wealth fund says its own analysis indicates that would be the wrong conclusion to draw.】

item.title: T. Rowe 成为重启的净零联盟250家签署机构之一
item.description: 在去年因美国成员集体退出而暂停运作后，资产管理公司的净零联盟已重新启动。【原文：A net zero alliance for asset managers has resurrected itself after shelving its work last year amid a wave of US defections.】

item.title: 中国将收紧空气质量法规，这些法规已助力大幅减少雾霾
item.description: 中国正计划自2012年以来首次大幅收紧国家空气质量标准，旨在延续这场在很大程度上取得成功的污染防治行动——该行动已重塑了中国部分经济领域。【原文：China is planning its first major tightening of national air quality standards since 2012, as it seeks to extend a largely successful anti-pollution campaign that’s reshaped parts of its economy.】

item.title: 英国能源账单跌至近两年低点 绿色成本改革引发震动
item.description: 英国能源账单将于4月降至近两年最低水平，此前政府将部分可再生能源补贴成本从家庭账单转移至一般税收。【原文：UK energy bills will drop to the lowest in almost two years in April, after the government moved part of the cost of supporting renewable energy from household bills to general taxation.】

item.title: 埃斯孔电力公司污染承诺反悔，恐惹世界银行不满
item.description: 南非国家电力公司（Eskom Holdings SOC Ltd.）作为全球最大的二氧化硫毒素排放源，近期发布的研究报告质疑安装限排设备的成本效益，此举可能导致违反世界银行贷款协议，并激怒环保活动人士。【原文：Eskom Holdings SOC Ltd., the world’s biggest emitter of the toxin sulfur dioxide, presented a study that argues against the cost of installing equipment to limit emissions, risking a breach of a World Bank loan agreement and riling environmental activists.】

item.title: 澳大利亚利纳斯公司规模已超越澳洲航空
item.description: 莱纳斯稀土公司市值已超越澳大利亚蓝筹股支柱企业澳洲航空公司，因市场担忧中国对关键矿产的垄断地位，推高了这家矿业公司的股价。【原文：Lynas Rare Earths Ltd. has overtaken Australian blue-chip stalwart Qantas Airways Ltd. by market capitalization, as concerns about China’s dominance of critical minerals lift the miner’s stock.】

item.title: 中国同维公司竞购竞争对手，加速太阳能行业整合
item.description: 中国多晶硅巨头通威公司计划收购一家规模较小的国内竞争对手，该行业正致力于缓解太阳能电池板材料长期供过于求的局面。【原文：Chinese polysilicon giant Tongwei Co. plans to buy a smaller domestic rival, as the industry bids to shrink chronic oversupply of the solar-panel material.】

item.title: 德国政府淡化争议性供暖法案
item.description: 德国政府同意废除一项备受争议的禁令，该禁令禁止安装新的天然气和石油供暖系统。此举源于总理弗里德里希·梅尔茨领导的保守派政党正全力兑现一项关键的选举承诺。【原文：The German government agreed to abolish a controversial ban on new gas and oil heating systems as Chancellor Friedrich Merz’ conservatives rush to deliver on a key electoral promise.】

item.title: 人工智能在预测纽约暴风雪方面不敌传统模型
item.description: 在纽约十年一遇的大雪暴来临前两天，气象预报员仍无法确定降雪量。美国传统气象模型持续预测将出现强降雪，而新型人工智能系统则对此持保留态度。【原文：Two days before New York's biggest snowstorm in a decade began, forecasters were still unsure how much snow would fall. One traditional US model had consistently predicted a major hit, while newer artificial intelligence systems weren't so certain.】

item.title: 欧洲最大商业游说团体呼吁改革碳市场
item.description: 欧洲最大的商业游说团体呼吁改革该地区规模达数十亿欧元的碳市场，以更好地支持工业发展，这为修改欧盟主要减排工具施加了更大压力。【原文：Europe’s largest business lobby called for reforms to the region’s multi-billion euro carbon market to better support industry, piling on more pressure to amend the bloc’s main emissions-cutting tool.】

item.title: 石油公司就气候变化诉讼案获最高法院听证
item.description: 美国最高法院同意受理埃克森美孚公司和太阳石油公司提出的上诉，此举旨在阻止数十起指控石油公司导致气候变化的城市及州级诉讼。【原文：The US Supreme Court agreed to hear an appeal by Exxon Mobil Corp. and Suncor Energy Inc. in an industry bid to stop dozens of city and state lawsuits that blame oil companies for climate change.】

Kennedy International airports as well as Boston Logan International Airport into Tuesday as a major blizzard heads for the region.】

item.title: 纽约市实施旅行禁令，因冬季风暴来袭停课

item.title: 特朗普支持的天然气厂或成美国最大电力污染源
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德·特朗普在俄亥俄州建造大型燃气发电厂的提议，很可能使该项目成为美国发电领域最大的二氧化碳排放源之一。【原文：US President Donald Trump’s proposal for a massive gas-fired power plant in Ohio would likely create one of the nation’s largest sources of carbon dioxide emissions from electricity generation.】

item.title: “超级炸弹”暴风雪将给纽约及东北部地区带来强降雪
item.description: 一场可能演变为"超级炸弹"的强劲冬季风暴正威胁着纽约市及东北部地区。从周日开始，该地区将遭遇深达数英尺的湿重积雪，并伴有热带风暴级别的阵风，极可能导致电线杆倒塌、航班停飞，使出行变得危及生命。【原文：A powerful winter storm that may turn into a “super bomb” threatens New York City and the Northeast with heavy, wet snow by the foot starting Sunday and tropical storm-strength wind gusts that are likely to drop power lines, ground planes and make travel life-threatening.】

The Environmental Protection Agency rolled back limits on mercury and other toxic air pollutants for coal- and oil-fired plants. 

】

item.title: 共和党因90亿美元石油项目将环保组织列为打击目标
item.description: 美国众议院共和党人已对六家环保组织展开调查，因这些组织反对康菲石油公司在阿拉斯加开发的一项价值90亿美元的石油项目。【原文：House Republicans have launched an investigation into six environmental organizations over their opposition to a $9 billion oil project developed by ConocoPhillips in Alaska.】

item.title: 纽约面临周末后期降雪，东海岸风暴正在增强
item.description: 周末后期的一场风暴可能给美国东海岸部分地区带来降雪，纽约及新英格兰南部地区截至周一可能出现数英寸积雪。【原文：A late-weekend storm could blanket parts of the Eastern Seaboard with snow, with several inches possible in New York and southern New England through Monday.】
